results.name: Number of ways n couples can sit in a row without any spouses next to each other.
comment: a(n) approaches (2n)!*exp(-1) as n goes to infinity.
Also the number of (directed) Hamiltonian paths of the n-cocktail party graph - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Dec 16 2013
link: Andrew Woods, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
G. Almkvist, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, Apr. 1992
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Cocktail Party Graph
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hamiltonian Path
formula: a(n) = n!*hypergeom([ -n, n+1],[],1/2)*(-2)^n. - _Mark van Hoeij_, Nov 13 2009
For n >= 1, int_{x = 0..1} (x^2 - 1)^n*exp(x) dx = a(n)*e - A177840(n). Hence A177840(n)/a(n) -> e as n -> infinity (End)
a(n) ~ sqrt(Pi) * 2^(2*n+1) * n^(2*n + 1/2) / exp(2*n+1). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 09 2016
program: (PARI) a(n)=sum(k=0, n, binomial(n, k)*(-1)^(n-k)*(n+k)!*2^(n-k)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 11 2016
def a(n): return sum([(-1)**(n - k)*binomial(n, k)*subfactorial(2*k) for k in range(n + 1)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 28 2017
